info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio REST API

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Flows.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Engagements for the Flow.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Triggers a new Engagement for the Flow

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The Contact phone number to start a Studio Flow Engagement, available as variable {{contact.channel.address}}.
parameters.name: To

parameters.description: The Twilio phone number to send messages or initiate calls from during the Flow Engagement, available as variable {{flow.channel.address}}
parameters.name: From

parameters.description: JSON data that will be added to your flow's context and can accessed as variables inside your flow. For example, if you pass in Parameters={'name':'Zeke'} then inside a widget you can reference the variable {{flow.data.name}} which will return the string 'Zeke'. Note: the JSON value must explicitly be passed as a string, not as a hash object. Depending on your particular HTTP library, you may need to add quotes or URL encode your JSON string.
parameters.name: Parameters

get.description: Retrieve the most recent context for an Engagement.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Engagement.
parameters.name: EngagementSid

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Steps for an Engagement.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Engagement.
parameters.name: EngagementSid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Engagement.
parameters.name: EngagementSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Step.
parameters.name: Sid

get.description: Retrieve the context for an Engagement Step.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Engagement.
parameters.name: EngagementSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Step.
parameters.name: StepSid

delete.description: Delete this Engagement and all Steps relating to it.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Engagement.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Engagement.
parameters.name: Sid

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Executions for the Flow.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: Only show Executions that started on or after this ISO8601 date-time, given as `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss-hh:mm`.
parameters.name: DateCreatedFrom

parameters.description: Only show Executions that started before this this ISO8601 date-time, given as `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss-hh:mm`.
parameters.name: DateCreatedTo

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

post.description: Triggers a new Execution for the Flow

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The Contact phone number to start a Studio Flow Execution, available as variable `{{contact.channel.address}}`.
parameters.name: To

parameters.description: The Twilio phone number to send messages or initiate calls from during the Flow Execution, available as variable `{{flow.channel.address}}`.
parameters.name: From

parameters.description: JSON data that will be added to your flow's context and can accessed as variables inside your flow. For example, if you pass in `Parameters={"name":"Zeke"}`, then inside a widget you can reference the variable `{{flow.data.name}}` which will return the string "Zeke". Note: the JSON value must explicitly be passed as a string, not as a hash object. Depending on your particular HTTP library, you may need to add quotes or URL encode your JSON string.
parameters.name: Parameters

get.description: Retrieve the most recent context for an Execution.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Execution.
parameters.name: ExecutionSid

get.description: Retrieve a list of all Steps for an Execution.

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Execution.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Execution.
parameters.name: ExecutionSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Step.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/Flows/{FlowSid}/Executions/{Executio.description: JSON context for an individual step within an execution

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Step.
parameters.name: StepSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Flow.
parameters.name: FlowSid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Execution.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Execution.
